alert.note: Alert for Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 10:35AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CHERRY... NORTHWESTERN ROCK...NORTHERN BROWN AND SOUTHWESTERN KEYA PAHA COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 AM CDT... At 1035 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Springview to 6 miles north of Johnstown. Movement was southeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ainsworth, Bassett, Springview, Long Pine, Johnstown, Wood Lake, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, North River Trail, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, and Antelope Peak. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 194 and 213. Highway 20 between mile markers 221 and 258. Highway 12 between mile markers 37 and 51. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Eastern Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock
